entries.journal_entry_description: A research outpost on Talus has been out of contact for a number of months, and none of the people sent to re-establish contact have been heard. Worried that something has gone wrong, you have been hired to investigate whatever is going on there.
entries.task00_journal_entry_description: Travel to Tyrena on Corellia and speak with Professor Cornelius Wagglehorn of Corellia University. If he's not found at the University, the Professor often enjoys looking out over the water while reading or studying.
entries.task01_journal_entry_description: Travel to Corellia University's Off-site Research Outpost on Talus.
entries.task02_journal_entry_description: "The Outpost is eerily silent as you approach. There should be students and researchers busily at work, but no one is visible. Other than a corpse in the center of the Outpost yard. Go check it."
entries.task02_message_box_text: The Outpost is eerily silent as you approach. There should be students and researchers busily at work, but no one is visible. Other than a corpse in the center of the Outpost yard. Go check it.
entries.task03_journal_entry_description: Check the corpse in the middle of the deserted outpost.
entries.task04_journal_entry_description: The corpse proves to be one of the researchers who was working at the university's outpost. Check his datapad for any information about what happened.
entries.task05_journal_entry_description: From the researcher's daily journals in the datapad, you determine that some strange cultists arrived unexpectedly at the outpost and began speaking with the students and researchers. Seemingly overnight, almost everyone at the outpost joined the cult. The dead researcher was one of the few to refuse. He seemed adamant that the cultist had some way of compelling others to join them and that those who joined did not do so of their own free will. He also mentions a location at which the former students (newly converted cultists) were being prepared for off-world transportation under the supervision of someone named Magnus Grenz.
entries.task05_message_box_text: From the researcher's daily journals in the datapad, you determine that some strange cultists arrived unexpectedly at the outpost and began speaking with the students and researchers. Seemingly overnight, almost everyone at the outpost joined the cult. The dead researcher was one of the few to refuse. He seemed adamant that the cultist had some way of compelling others to join them and that those who joined did not do so of their own free will. He also mentions a location at which the former students (newly converted cultists) were being prepared for off-world transportation under the supervision of someone named Magnus Grenz.
entries.task06_journal_entry_description: Use the outpost communication terminal and send word to Professor Wagglehorn that the Outpost is secure though vacated. With that news, a team from the University will be sent to investigate the Outpost further.
entries.task07_journal_entry_description: Travel to where the students are being sent off-world and confront Magnus Grenz. Ask him what has happened to the students and researchers from the outpost.
entries.task07_utterance_wave_2: There are plenty more where those came from...
entries.task07_utterance_wave_4: You are beginning to annoy me.
entries.task09_item_name: You find an entry about the cult
entries.task09_journal_entry_description: Find Grenz's personal data terminal and search it for any information you can find about the cult
entries.task10_journal_entry_description: You learn that the cult is devoted to the will of Exar Kun, a long deceased Sith Lord, and based on Yavin IV.
entries.task10_message_box_text: You learn that the cult is devoted to the will of Exar Kun, a long deceased Sith Lord, and based on Yavin IV.
entries.task11_journal_entry_description: Return to Professor Wagglehorn on Corellia.
